benchmark_details.name: JudiFair
benchmark_details.overview: JudiFair is an evaluation benchmark comprising 177,100 unique case facts across 65 labels, designed to measure judicial fairness in large language models (LLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate judicial fairness in large language models used in high-stakes decision-making contexts.

data.source: JudiFair dataset constructed from legal documents and annotated by legal experts.
data.annotation: Annotated by a team of legal experts using a combination of automated and manual methods.

methodology.calculation: Calculated using regression models controlling for document effects and evaluating statistical significance of label impacts.
methodology.interpretation: Results indicate the presence of bias and unfairness patterns among different demographic labels.
methodology.baseline_results: Results from 16 LLMs showed significant biases and inconsistencies across multiple demographic labels.
methodology.validation: Validated through rigorous statistical testing and expert review.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of demographic factors indicates significant bias against various population segments.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No personally identifiable information was used; all data sourced from publicly available datasets.
